title: Growing Corn Basics Time Lapse - 6 days

tasks.task: Drive a tractor through a field at a speed of 6 to 6.8 KPH.
subtasks: Sit in the tractor's驾驶 seat.
Adjust the tractor's speed to 6 to 6.8 KPH.
Operate the steering wheel to guide the tractor through the field.
Monitor the tractor's movement to ensure it stays on the desired path.
Adjust speed as necessary to avoid obstacles or uneven terrain.
Keep an eye on surroundings to maintain safe operation.

tasks.task: Attach a hoe (replace with specific equipment if needed) to the tractor.
subtasks: Approach the tractor hitch.
Align the hoe or attachment with the hitch.
Securely fasten the attachment to the tractor using appropriate hardware.
Check the attachment for stability and adjust as needed.

tasks.task: Use the attached equipment to cultivate the soil.
subtasks: Start the equipment by following the operator's manual.
Adjust the depth and width of the tillage as needed.
Monitor the equipment's operation for effectiveness and efficiency.
Make minor adjustments to the equipment during use if necessary.

tasks.task: Load the soil into a cart or wagon attached to the tractor.
subtasks: Wait for the soil to be ready to load.
Approach the cart or wagon.
Lift the soil into the cart or wagon using the tractor's hydraulic loader.
Check that the load is secure and even.
Repeat until the cart or wagon is fully loaded.

tasks.task: Transport the soil to a designated area.
subtasks: Drive the tractor with the loaded cart to the area.
Align the cart with the drop point.
Lower the soil from the cart onto the designated area.
Repeat until all loads have been transported.
Position the cart or wagon at the unloading spot.
Raise the hydraulic loader to lift the soil from the cart.
Release the soil onto the ground or designated unloading area.
Lower the hydraulic loader and secure the cart or wagon.

tasks.task: Repeat the process as needed to complete the day's work, which includes:
subtasks: Continue moving through the field, repeating steps for driving, attaching equipment, cultivating, loading, transporting, and unloading until the area is properly cultivated and the soil is distributed as required.
Ensure that breaks are taken as needed for rest or lunch.
At the end of the day, clean equipment and prepare the tractor for storage.
